org.assertj.swing.driver

Class ComponentDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.swing.driver.ComponentDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContainerDriver, JAppletDriver

    @InternalApi
public class ComponentDriver
extends java.lang.Object

    Supports functional testing of AWT or Swing Components.

    Note: This class is intended for internal use only. Please use the classes in the package org.assertj.swing.fixture in your tests.

    Author:
    Alex Ruiz

      • click

        @RunsInEDT
public void click(@Nonnull
                   java.awt.Component c)
        Simulates a user clicking once the given AWT or Swing Component using the left mouse button.
        Parameters:
        c - the Component to click on.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.

public void click(@Nonnull
                   java.awt.Component c,
                   @Nonnull
                   MouseButton button)
        Simulates a user clicking once the given AWT or Swing Component using the given mouse button.
        Parameters:
        c - the Component to click on.
        button - the mouse button to use.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given MouseButton is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.

                   java.awt.Component c,
                   @Nonnull

        Parameters:
        c - the Component to click on.
        mouseClickInfo - specifies the button to click and the times the button should be clicked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given MouseClickInfo is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.

                         java.awt.Component c,

        size - the given size to match.
        Throws:

                            @Nonnull

        Parameters:
        c - the target Component.
        timeout - the time this fixture will wait for the Component to be enabled.
        Throws:
        WaitTimedOutError - if the Component is never enabled.

      • pressAndReleaseKeys

        @RunsInEDT
public void pressAndReleaseKeys(@Nonnull
                                 java.awt.Component c,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 int... keyCodes)
        Simulates a user pressing and releasing the given keys on the AWT or Swing Component.
        Parameters:
        c - the target Component.
        keyCodes - one or more codes of the keys to press.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given array of codes is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given code is not a valid key code.
        See Also:
        KeyEvent

      • pressAndReleaseKey

        @RunsInEDT
public void pressAndReleaseKey(@Nonnull
                                java.awt.Component c,
                                @Nonnull
                                KeyPressInfo keyPressInfo)
        Simulates a user pressing and releasing the given key on the AWT or Swing Component. Modifiers is a mask from the available AWT InputEvent masks.
        Parameters:
        c - the target Component.
        keyPressInfo - specifies the key and modifiers to press.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given KeyPressInfo is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given code is not a valid key code.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.
        See Also:
        KeyEvent, InputEvent

      • pressAndReleaseKey

        @RunsInEDT
public void pressAndReleaseKey(@Nonnull
                                java.awt.Component c,
                                int keyCode,
                                @Nonnull
                                int[] modifiers)
        Simulates a user pressing and releasing the given key on the AWT or Swing Component. Modifiers is a mask from the available AWT InputEvent masks.
        Parameters:
        c - the target Component.
        keyCode - the code of the key to press.
        modifiers - the given modifiers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given code is not a valid key code. *
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.
        See Also:
        KeyEvent, InputEvent

      • focus

        @RunsInEDT
public void focus(@Nonnull
                   java.awt.Component c)
        Gives input focus to the given AWT or Swing Component. Note that the Component may not yet have focus when this method returns.
        Parameters:
        c - the Component to give focus to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.

      • drag

        @RunsInEDT
protected final void drag(@Nonnull
                  java.awt.Component c,
                  @Nonnull
                  java.awt.Point where)
        Performs a drag action at the given point.
        Parameters:
        c - the target Component.
        where - the point where to start the drag action.

      • drop

        @RunsInEDT
protected final void drop(@Nonnull
                  java.awt.Component c,
                  @Nonnull
                  java.awt.Point where)

        Ends a drag operation, releasing the mouse button over the given target location.

        This method is tuned for native drag/drop operations, so if you get odd behavior, you might try using a simple Robot.moveMouse(Component, int, int) and Robot.releaseMouseButtons().

        Parameters:
        c - the target Component.
        where - the point where the drag operation ends.
        Throws:
        ActionFailedException - if there is no drag action in effect.

      • dragOver

        protected final void dragOver(@Nonnull
            java.awt.Component c,
            @Nonnull
            java.awt.Point where)
        Move the mouse appropriately to get from the source to the destination. Enter/exit events will be generated where appropriate.
        Parameters:
        c - the target Component.
        where - the point to drag over.

      • performAccessibleActionOf

        @RunsInCurrentThread
protected final void performAccessibleActionOf(@Nonnull
                                                 java.awt.Component c)

        Performs the AccessibleAction in the given AWT or Swing Component's event queue.

        Note: This method is accessed in the current executing thread. Such thread may or may not be the event dispatch thread (EDT.) Client code must call this method from the EDT.

        Parameters:
        c - the given Component.
        Throws:
        ActionFailedException - if something goes wrong.

      • waitForShowing

        @RunsInCurrentThread
protected final boolean waitForShowing(@Nonnull
                                         java.awt.Component c,
                                         long timeout)

        Wait the given number of milliseconds for the AWT or Swing Component to be showing and ready. Returns false if the operation times out.

        Note: This method is accessed in the current executing thread. Such thread may or may not be the event dispatch thread (EDT.) Client code must call this method from the EDT.

        Parameters:
        c - the given Component.
        timeout - the time in milliseconds to wait for the Component to be showing and ready.
        Returns:
        true if the Component is showing and ready, false otherwise.

      • invokePopupMenu

        @RunsInEDT
@Nonnull
public javax.swing.JPopupMenu invokePopupMenu(@Nonnull
                                                       java.awt.Component c)
        Shows a pop-up menu using the given AWT or Swing Component as the invoker of the pop-up menu.
        Parameters:
        c - the invoker of the JPopupMenu.
        Returns:
        the displayed pop-up menu.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the given Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the given Component is not showing on the screen.
        ComponentLookupException - if a pop-up menu cannot be found.

      • invokePopupMenu

        @RunsInEDT
@Nonnull
public javax.swing.JPopupMenu invokePopupMenu(@Nonnull
                                                       java.awt.Component c,
                                                       @Nonnull
                                                       java.awt.Point p)
        Shows a pop-up menu at the given point using the given AWT or Swing Component as the invoker of the pop-up menu.
        Parameters:
        c - the invoker of the JPopupMenu.
        p - the given point where to show the pop-up menu.
        Returns:
        the displayed pop-up menu.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given point is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the given Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the given Component is not showing on the screen.
        ComponentLookupException - if a pop-up menu cannot be found.

      • checkInEdtEnabledAndShowing

        @RunsInEDT
protected static void checkInEdtEnabledAndShowing(@Nonnull
                                         java.awt.Component c)
        Verifies that the given AWT or Swing Component is enabled and showing on the screen. This method is executed in the event dispatch thread (EDT.)
        Parameters:
        c - the Component to check.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is disabled.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Component is not showing on the screen.

      • propertyName

        @RunsInEDT
@Nonnull
public static org.assertj.core.description.Description propertyName(@Nonnull
                                                                      java.awt.Component c,
                                                                      @Nonnull
                                                                      java.lang.String propertyName)
        Formats the name of a property of the given AWT or Swing Component by concatenating the value obtained from Formatting.format(Component) with the given property name.
        Parameters:
        c - the given Component.
        propertyName - the name of the property.
        Returns:
        the description of a property belonging to a Component.
        See Also:
        ComponentFormatter, Formatting.format(Component)

      • moveMouseIgnoringAnyError

        @RunsInEDT
protected final void moveMouseIgnoringAnyError(@Nonnull
                                       java.awt.Component c,
                                       @Nonnull
                                       java.awt.Point p)
        Simulates a user moving the mouse pointer to the given coordinates relative to the given AWT or Swing Component. This method will not throw any exceptions if the it was not possible to move the mouse pointer.
        Parameters:
        c - the given Component.
        p - coordinates relative to the given Component.

      • moveMouseIgnoringAnyError

        @RunsInEDT
protected final void moveMouseIgnoringAnyError(@Nonnull
                                       java.awt.Component c,
                                       int x,
                                       int y)
        Simulates a user moving the mouse pointer to the given coordinates relative to the given AWT or Swing Component. This method will not throw any exceptions if the it was not possible to move the mouse pointer.
        Parameters:
        c - the given Component.
        x - horizontal coordinate relative to the given Component.
        y - vertical coordinate relative to the given Component.
